alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 2:27PM MST until January 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 10 and 20 inches. Winds gusting between 40 and 60 mph through this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches possible. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region Zone. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Wednesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken. Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
